summary.para: The GetDDrawObject method retrieves the DirectDraw object being used by the Overlay Mixer filter.

param.name: ppDDrawObject
param.para: Address of a pointer to the IDirectDraw interface that the Overlay Mixer is using.

param.name: pbUsingExternal
param.para: Pointer to a variable that receives a Boolean value. It receives the value TRUE if the Overlay Mixer is using a DirectDraw object specified by , or FALSE otherwise.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include the following.

description.para: A DirectDraw error is encountered when trying to set the specified surface on the Overlay Mixer.

remarks.para: If the filter graph has not set a DirectDraw object and the Overlay Mixer has not yet allocated one, then pDDrawObject will be set to NULL and pbUsingExternal will be set to FALSE.

summary.para: The GetNativeVideoProps method retrieves the current video size and picture aspect ratio of the Overlay Mixer's primary stream.

param.name: pdwVideoWidth
param.para: Address of variable that receives the width of the video.

param.name: pdwVideoHeight
param.para: Address of variable that receives the height of the video.

param.name: pdwPictAspectRatioX
param.para: Address of variable that receives the x-axis aspect ratio.

param.name: pdwPictAspectRatioY
param.para: Address of variable that receives the y-axis aspect ratio.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include the following.

remarks.para: The filter graph should look for the EC_VIDEO_SIZE_CHANGED event, and on its receipt call this method to adjust the aspect ratio and position.

summary.para: The SetCallbackInterface method retrieves a pointer to the callback interface of the Overlay Mixer so that the calling application can be notified about adjustments to the display during video playback.

param.name: pCallback
param.para: Pointer to the object that implements the interface. If pCallback is NULL, the callback interface is set to NULL and no more callbacks are made. If there was a previous callback interface, it is released and no more callbacks are made to it. If pCallback is not NULL and this method returns S_OK, then the reference count of the object pCallback points to is incremented.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include the following.

remarks.para: An application should use this method to get notification about the overlay size, position, or color key change happening, so that it can hide or show the video, or adjust the video at the start, end, or during playback. By calling this method, an application can access the interface and pass the pointer to that interface to the Overlay Mixer.

summary.para: The IDDrawExclModeVideo interface enables video playback in DirectDraw exclusive full-screen mode. The Overlay Mixer Filter implements this interface. Game applications can use DirectDraw in exclusive full-screen mode and continue playing video. For example, the video can be in the background and graphics can be used on top of it. The application passes in a DirectDraw object and primary surface, and these are passed to the Overlay Mixer filter in the filter graph.
The DVD graph builder object uses IDDrawExclModeVideo to play DVD content while in DirectDraw exclusive full-screen mode. This interface can also be used alone to play MPEG-1 or AVI videos in games.
